business.headline: Sensex tumbles 733 points as pharma, IT stocks hitThe sell-off came after the United States announced a steep 100% tariff on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products, effective October 1.

Indian air passengers rise to 131.7 lakh in August 2025 amid rising costs: ReportIndia's aviation sector is bouncing back, but the journey isn't without turbulence. Rising fuel costs, operational challenges, and financial pressures are testing airlines, even as passenger traffic shows steady growth.

Sensex tanks 800 points: Why is stock market falling today?By 2:37 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had lost 782.71 points to trade at 80,376.97, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 247.10 points to 24,643.75. Both indices were on track to end the week in negative territory.

Investors brace for IPO wave as 18 public listings hit Dalal Street next weekThe four mainboard IPOs opening next week together aim to raise over Rs 850 crore. Apart from them, 14 SME IPOs will also open for bidding next week.

Why more insurance policyholders are turning to private grievance platformsAs claim rejections soar and official channels frustrate, policyholders turn to private grievance platforms. Experts warn regulatory reform and competent brokers could restore trust in India's struggling insurance system.

From EMIs to assets: How home loans are creating India's new wealth generationIn India, home loans are doing more than financing houses—they are quietly shaping the country's next generation of wealth. Every EMI paid is becoming a step toward financial growth and stability.

Crypto in slump. 3 reasons why Bitcoin, Ethereum and Dogecoin are strugglingThe cryptocurrency market is struggling, and major tokens are taking the hit. Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Dogecoin have all dropped as investors react to a mix of macroeconomic uncertainty, liquidations, and upcoming market events.

EPFO 3.0 roll-out likely delayed, ATM withdrawals pushed to 2026The wait for EPFO 3.0 just got longer. While the update is set to make provident fund services more seamless, its highlight feature, ATM withdrawals, is now likely to come into effect in 2026.

Why Trump's MAGA is impossible without Indian CEOsThe list of Indian-origin CEOs in global technology and beyond is long and growing. Satya Nadella leads Microsoft, Sundar Pichai is at Alphabet and Google, Arvind Krishna heads IBM, Shantanu Narayen runs Adobe, and Neal Mohan was appointed YouTube CEO in 2023.

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.
Dalal Street outlook: Is market entering a consolidation phase?

Cipla, Dr. Reddy's, Sun Pharma: Why pharma stocks are falling todayAt 9:39 am, Sun Pharma fell 2.94% to Rs 1,548, Cipla dropped 1.92% to Rs 1,475, and Dr. Reddy's Laboratories slipped 1.17% to Rs 1,275. The sector's decline added to the broader weakness in equity markets.

entertainment.headline: Vicky Kaushal, Varun Dhawan's Perfect gym reel is pure Punjabi munda vibe Vicky Kaushal and Varun Dhawan have set social media abuzz with a lively reel dancing to Guru Randhawa's Punjabi track 'Perfect'. The upbeat video, shot in a gym, has fans and celebrities praising the perfect sync of the two stars as the film gears up for 'Sunny Sanskari's' October 2 release.

Shinchan Kasukabe Dancers review: A wild mix of chaos and cultural clichesRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025 Shinchan Kasukabe Dancers review: Chaos, comedy, and heartfelt moments abound as Shinchan brings mischief and Indian flavour to his latest adventure.

Bobby Deol backs Sandeep Reddy Vanga's grey characters, avoids debate on his films Actor Bobby Deol recently recalled his working experience with director Sandeep Reddy Vanga in Animal. He refused to react to the debate over the kind of films the 'Animal' director makes.

One Battle After Another review: Leonardo DiCaprio leads Paul Anderson's wild rideRelease Date:Fri Sep 26, 2025 Paul Thomas Anderson's 'One Battle After Another' brings political satire and pulpy action together. The film explores family ties and rebellion with chaotic energy and bold performances.

Salman Khan's Bigg Boss 19 sued for alleged unauthorised use of Chikni Chameli Hosted by Bollywood superstar Salman Khan, 'Bigg Boss 19' has been sued for using two Bollywood songs without proper authorisation. The show allegedly faces a lawsuit of Rs 2 crore for using 'Chikni Chameli' and 'Dhat Teri Ki.'

Aryan Khan has been through a lot, which no child should ever go: Bobby Deol Bobby Deol acknowledged that Aryan Khan has faced significant challenges following his directorial debut with 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'. This comes after Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against Shah Rukh Khan, Red Chillies Entertainment, and Netflix.

Alice in Borderland Season 3 review: The games return, but the magic wears thinRelease Date:Thu Sep 25, 2025 'Alice in Borderland Season 3' returns with new games and the mysterious Joker card. The season struggles with storytelling but impresses with its visual style and moral questions.

Madharaasi OTT release: When and where to watch Sivakarthikeyan's action thriller Director AR Murugadoss's 'Madharaasi', featuring actor Sivakarthikeyan is set to premiere on Prime Video on October 1, 2025. The film also features actors Rukimini Vasanth, Vidyut Jamwal and others in key roles.

Rajat Bedi jumps to ninth spot on IMDb India after Ba***ds success Actor Rajat Bedi has risen from 954th to the ninth position on IMDb India. The jump follows his role in Aryan Khan's directorial debut series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood', which is currently streaming on Netflix.

Anya Singh's rebirth with The Ba***ds of Bollywood: She's winning hearts and how! Anya Singh's performance in 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood' has earned widespread recognition. The actor's journey from a non-filmy background to the spotlight highlights her determination and growing influence in Indian entertainment.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 33: Baseer apologises to Awez's family, Nagma Baseer Ali apologised to Awez Darbar's family and his girlfriend, Nagma Mirajkar, who was also a part of 'Bigg Boss 19.'  He had earlier claimed that Awez was disloyal to Nagma. In episode 33, Awez watched a clip of Baseer discussing the matter with Amaal Mallik and Zeishan Quadri.

Nagarjuna, Tabu, Sreeleela and celebs dazzle at Kalyanaraman family's Navratri Puja Like every year, the Kalyanaraman family's Navratri celebrations in Thrissur, Kerala, were a grand event with a bevy of stars present. Take a look at who all attended the puja.

Farah Khan denies ignoring Aayush Sharma in viral video Farah Khan has dismissed claims of ignoring Aayush Sharma at an event as nonsense, clarifying that she did not see him in the rush and recently shot a vlog with him.

Parineeti, Imtiaz elated on Amar Singh Chamkila's International Emmy nomination After Diljit Dosanjh, actor Parineeti Chopra and director Imtiaz Ali expressed joy and gratitude as 'Amar Singh Chamkila' secured International Emmy nominations. The film has been nominated in the Best Actor and Best TV Movie categories.

Case against Pawan Kalyan fans for creating chaos at OG screening in Bengaluru Trouble has mounted for Pawan Kalyan fans after they created a chaos at a Bengaluru theatre. The film released in theatres on September 25.

Homebound cleared with 11 cuts, cricket scene trimmed, certain dialogues muted Filmmaker Neeraj Ghaywan's 'Homebound' was cleared by the censor board with 11 cuts. The film's runtime was also shortened by 77 seconds.

OG box office Day 1: Pawan Kalyan's film explodes to massive Rs 100-crore haul Pawan Kalyan's 'They Call Him OG' smashed Rs 100 crore on its opening day, including paid premieres. The gangster drama, directed by Sujeeth, has received glowing reviews from fans.

Farhan Akhtar moved by Dwayne Johnson's The Smashing Machine: Can't wait to see Dwayne Johnson impressed fans with his physical transformation in the upcoming biopic 'The Smashing Machine'. After getting international recognition, the film found a fan in Bolllywood actor Farhan Akhtar.

Janaawar review: Bhuvan Arora' show delivers hard-hitting take on caste, society 'Janaawar: The Beast Within' is a gripping crime drama set in a small town, with Bhuvan Arora shining as a cop balancing duty and family. The series explores caste, identity, and the darker sides of human nature. Read our review.

general news.headline: Activist Sonam Wangchuk arrested days after violent statehood protests in LadakhLadakh activist Sonam Wangchuk arrested under National Security Act days after violent statehood protests

Trump slaps 100% tariff on branded pharma drug imports: Should India worry?For now, experts say that India's generic drug exports remain largely safe, though any future extension of US tariffs to generics could disrupt the sector and investor sentiment.

Nato chief claims Modi, hit by tariffs, phoned Putin and asked for Ukraine planNATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte stated that Trump's tariffs on India are affecting Russia, prompting PM Modi to seek clarification from Putin on Moscow's strategy in Ukraine.

MiG-21 testimony to India-Russia ties, not just aircraft: Rajnath at jet's farewellDefence minister Rajnath Singh said the MiG-21 is not just an aircraft but a testimony to India-Russia ties. He added that from the 1971 war to the Balakot airstrike, the jet has stood as a symbol of strength and valour for the armed forces.

Blood and snow: How Ladakh became a part of IndiaIt was the bravery and military campaign of Zorawar Singh Kahluria, a General of Jammu king Gulab Singh, that first brought Ladakh into the Dogra fold in 1834. The sale of Jammu and Kashmir by the British to Gulab Singh in 1846, and his great-grandson Hari Singh's signing of the treaty of accession in 1947, made Ladakh an integral part of India.

Lalu's kidney spills RJD beansJust ahead of the Bihar Assembly election, a rift within the RJD's first family is out in the open. In 2022, Lalu Prasad Yadav's daughter, Rohini Acharya, donated her kidney to him in a transplant done in Singapore. Now, questions are being asked if Rohini was actually the donor. While she hints the doubts were being created at the behest of Tejashwi Yadav's trusted aide, Sanjay Yadav, her eldest brother, Tej Pratap Yadav, has sided with her.

Court rejects Rahul Gandhi's plea, clears path for case in Sikh turban remark rowThe dismissal of Rahul Gandhi's plea in the Allahabad High Court will now pave the way for the revision petition to proceed in the Varanasi MP/MLA court.
Bogus will deprived us: Karisma Kapoor's children to court in Sunjay Kapur caseBogus will deprived us of everything: Karisma Kapoor's children to court in Sunjay Kapur's assets case

Why Indian elections are mostly free but rarely fairWhile Indian elections have become freer, they are much less fairer. At the heart of electoral democracy is the belief in a 'Level Playing Field' (LPL): every candidate and party who contests should begin from the same starting point. Instead, now we have a totally skewed race where those in power have a massive advantage over their rivals.

The MiG-21 truth: Pilots reveal the deadly power of F-16 killerFor over six decades, the MiG-21 defended India's skies and helped train generations of pilots. Yet, despite its reputation as a workhorse, upgrade and spares woes marred its legacy. As the Indian Air Force (IAF) restores its fleet of MiG-21, pilots who flew it defend the trusted war bird.

Trump claimed witch-hunt, now he is serving revenge with lawfareUS President Donald Trump has escalated lawfare against his perceived rivals, targeting James Comey, John Bolton, Marc Elias and others, whom he views as part of an alleged witch-hunt carried out against him. Trump is punishing them through investigations, purges at the Department of Justice and FBI raids.

Fear of arrest? Netanyahu's jet skips European skies, takes longer route to USIsraeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's flight to New York for the UN General Assembly this week took a noticeably longer route than necessary, avoiding much of Europe.

The Gucci glow-up: Alia Bhatt's boldest fashion era yetWith over a decade in the film industry, Alia's style has always been a source of inspiration - especially with her ethnic looks and effortlessly relatable choices. But ever since her Gucci contract, she's been pushing the envelope like never before, radiating a true global fashion appeal.

Farhan says gunshot gesture not political in ICC hearing: Dhoni, Kohli have done sameSahibzada Farhan clarified that his on-field celebration against India in the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash on Sunday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium was cultural, not politically motivated.

Asked about 'U' not getting bail, DY Chandrachud mentions 'P'. What's the case?Former CJI DY Chandrachud stressed that "every single individual who deserved bail got bail" during his tenure. To illustrate, he referred to the case of Congress leader Pawan Khera.

Tamil Nadu Minister says women in North India still judged by husbands, sparks rowTamil Nadu Industries Minister TRB Rajaa sparked controversy by comparing women in Tamil Nadu and North India. BJP's Shehzad Poonawalla criticised the remarks as insulting UP and Bihar women.

Astronaut shows vein-like patterns in world's largest Amazon RiverIn the image, shared from orbit, the Amazon appears almost like a living organism, its vast network of tributaries branching out like veins across tens of kilometres of floodplain.

Normal test results don't always mean a healthy thyroid. What to do instead?Thyroid problems are often underdiagnosed because their symptoms mimic many common health issues, making misdiagnosis frequent.

Voter roll revision like note ban, medicine in search of disease: Yogendra YadavWhile addressing a session at the ongoing 2025 India Today Conclave Mumbai, a flagship event of the India Today Group., Yogendra Yadav said, "SIR is not a voter list revision, it is a master, manipulative reset."

Apple Watch Series 11 review: Come for sleep tracking, stay for long battery lifeThe new Apple Watch Series 11 looks and works almost similar to the Watch Series 10. But it does bring better battery life, which makes a real difference in use.

Shashi Tharoor's witty comeback to Suhel Seth's Oxford 'sole mate' remark goes viralOn X, Suhel Seth shared a picture from Oxford University, the site where the Oxford English Dictionary was created, and joked that the dictionary was Shashi Tharoor's "sole mate."

Why BJP chose Biplab Deb for a crucial state like West BengalBiplab Deb's journey within the BJP, from a Delhi-based karyakarta to the Chief Minister of Tripura and now a Lok Sabha MP, reflects both political acumen and organisational grit.

Foreign trips, iPhones: How molestation-accused Delhi baba 'lured' women studentsSwami Chaitanyananda Saraswati, the former head of a management institute in Vasant Kunj, is currently on the run after more than 15 women students accused him of molestation, blackmail and intimidation.

Earth could overcorrect rising temperatures by ushering global ice ageThe extent of this cooling effect depends heavily on atmospheric oxygen levels. In Earth's distant past, when oxygen was lower, the planet entered unstable cycles that triggered extreme ice ages.

sports.headline: Break India's aura, take them on: Shoaib Akhtar tells Pakistan before Asia Cup final Legendary pacer Shoaib Akhtar told Pakistan to go into the Asia Cup final with the aim of breaking India's aura. Pakistan defeated Bangladesh by 11 runs to progress to the summit clash of the tournament.

KL Rahul 176, Sai Sudharsan 100 steer India A to big win vs Australia A Indian opener KL Rahul produced a sublime unbeaten 176, while Sai Sudharsan followed with a classy century, as India A pulled off a stunning chase against Australia A in the second unofficial Test in Kanpur. The Dhruv Jurel-led side chased down 413 runs in just 91.3 overs.

After taking Andhra job, Gary Stead accepts new role with New Zealand cricket After taking over as the new head coach of the Andhra state team, Gary Stead has accepted a role with New Zealand cricket and has become their high performance coach. Stead will be allowed to work outside of New Zealand cricket despite taking up the new job.

Farhan says gunshot gesture not political in ICC hearing: Dhoni, Kohli have done same Sahibzada Farhan clarified that his on-field celebration against India in the Asia Cup 2025 Super 4 clash on Sunday at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium was cultural, not politically motivated.

Sergio Busquets set to retire at the end of MLS season: A look at his career Sergio Busquets, Inter Miami and Barcelona legend, has decided to retire from professional football at the end of the 2025 MLS season. With 36 major trophies for club and country, the midfield maestro leaves behind a rich legacy.

Karun Nair WI series snub: Selectors moving on from batter, says Dinesh Karthik Dinesh Karthik believes that the India selectors have moved on from Karun Nair after the Karnataka batter was dropped from the squad for the West Indies Test series. Karun was replaced by Devdutt Padikkal in the team.

Shubman Gill in awe of Smriti Mandhana: She has the lazy elegance of Damien Martyn Women's World Cup: Shubman Gill said Smriti Mandhana plays with the "lazy elegance" of former Australian batter Damien Martyn. Mandhana recently became India's fastest centurion in ODIs.

No Bumrah perks, but Mohammed Shami toiling to keep India comeback dream alive India fast bowler Mohammed Shami is training behind the scenes, hoping to make an India comeback at the age of 35. People close to Shami have been infuriated by the preferential treatment given to some of the other players in the team.

Abhishek Sharma drops stylish Dubai pics, Guru Yuvraj has hilarious response Abhishek Sharma's latest post on Instagram got a hilarious comment from his guru Yuvraj Singh, who decided to have some fun at the expense of his young disciple. Abhishek posted images from his free time in Dubai.

Ashes: Joe Root eyes beyond milestone 100 vs Australia, confident in different England Joe Root promises England will approach the Ashes Down Under with a fresh mindset, that can toruble Australia. While a century in Australia remains elusive, his focus is on winning matches and reclaiming the urn.

PR Sreejesh reveals India senior team coach ambitions, wants World Cup glory In an exclusive interaction with India Today, PR Sreejesh said that he aims to coach the India men's senior team and win the World Cup with them. Sreejesh commented on his life after retirement, his mentor role with SG Pipers and much more.

Shubman Gill in awe of Smriti Mandhana: She has the lazy elegance of Damien Martyn Women's World Cup: Shubman Gill said Smriti Mandhana plays with the "lazy elegance" of former Australian batter Damien Martyn. Mandhana recently became India's fastest centurion in ODIs.

No Bumrah perks, but Mohammed Shami toiling to keep India comeback dream alive India fast bowler Mohammed Shami is training behind the scenes, hoping to make an India comeback at the age of 35. People close to Shami have been infuriated by the preferential treatment given to some of the other players in the team.

Abhishek Sharma drops stylish Dubai pics, Guru Yuvraj has hilarious response Abhishek Sharma's latest post on Instagram got a hilarious comment from his guru Yuvraj Singh, who decided to have some fun at the expense of his young disciple. Abhishek posted images from his free time in Dubai.

Ashes: Joe Root eyes beyond milestone 100 vs Australia, confident in different England Joe Root promises England will approach the Ashes Down Under with a fresh mindset, that can toruble Australia. While a century in Australia remains elusive, his focus is on winning matches and reclaiming the urn.

PR Sreejesh reveals India senior team coach ambitions, wants World Cup glory In an exclusive interaction with India Today, PR Sreejesh said that he aims to coach the India men's senior team and win the World Cup with them. Sreejesh commented on his life after retirement, his mentor role with SG Pipers and much more.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
